Location: On wrist crease at ulnar side, in depression between pisiform bone and ulna. Radial to flexor carpi ulnaris tendon.
TCM Actions: Calms Shen (Spirit), nourishes Heart blood, clears Heart fire, regulates Heart Qi
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: PRIMARY POINT for grief insomnia. Treats difficulty falling asleep from emotional disturbance, anxiety, palpitations, excessive dreaming, waking easily. Especially effective for Heart-Lung Qi deficiency patterns with sadness. The Spirit cannot return home to rest.
Needling & Research Evidence: Shu-Stream & Yuan-Source point. 0.3-0.5 cun perpendicular. 2024 systematic review shows highest frequency in insomnia treatment. RCT evidence: HT7+KI7 significantly improved PSQI and ISI scores. Most commonly used insomnia point globally.

Location: 2 cun above wrist crease, between tendons of palmaris longus and flexor carpi radialis
TCM Actions: Opens chest, calms Shen, regulates Heart Qi, relieves chest oppression, harmonizes Stomach
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Excellent for insomnia with anxiety, chest tightness, palpitations from grief. Treats 'can't shut mind off' type insomnia with rumination. Opens emotional blockages. Effective for grief with somatization in chest area.
Needling & Research Evidence: Luo-Connecting point of Pericardium. 0.5-1.0 cun perpendicular. 2024 meta-analysis shows PC6 in top 5 most used insomnia points. Modulates amygdala and default-mode network. High confidence in association rule analysis for sleep.

Point Name: SP-6 (Sanyinjiao 三阴交 Three Yin Intersection)
Location: 3 cun above medial malleolus, posterior to medial border of tibia
TCM Actions: Tonifies Spleen, nourishes Yin and Blood, calms Shen, regulates menstruation, benefits Kidneys
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Core point for insomnia from Qi-Blood deficiency after grief. Treats waking easily at night, poor sleep quality, nighttime anxiety. Nourishes all three Yin channels. Essential for women with grief affecting menstrual cycle and sleep.
Needling & Research Evidence: Intersection of 3 Yin channels (Spleen, Liver, Kidney). 0.5-1.0 cun perpendicular. RCT: HT7+SP6 combination most effective. 2024 review: SP6 is CORE point, highest confidence in network topology analysis. Contraindicated in pregnancy.

Point Name: Anmian (安眠 Peaceful Sleep) - Extra Point
Location: Behind ear, midpoint between Sishencong (GV-20) and Yifeng (SJ-17). Behind mastoid process.
TCM Actions: Specifically calms Shen and induces sleep. Sedates overactive mind. Nourishes Heart-Kidney connection.
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Named 'Peaceful Sleep' - designed for insomnia. Excellent for grief-related sleep issues with racing thoughts, inability to calm mind. Treats both difficulty falling asleep AND staying asleep. Reduces nighttime anxiety and restlessness.
Needling & Research Evidence: Extra point specifically for insomnia. 0.5-0.8 cun perpendicular or oblique toward GV-20. Clinical studies show Anmian reduces sleep latency and improves sleep depth. Often combined with Shenmen points. Traditional insomnia protocol includes this point.

Location: On midline of head, 5 cun above anterior hairline, at apex of ears. Top of head at vertex.
TCM Actions: Calms Shen, clears mind, raises Yang Qi, benefits brain, regulates autonomic nervous system
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Top evidence-based point for grief trauma (78.6% of PTSD studies). Treats insomnia from overthinking, mental exhaustion, anxiety. Clears mental fog. Excellent for rumination preventing sleep. Regulates HPA axis and cortisol.
Needling & Research Evidence: Meeting point of all Yang channels. 0.3-0.5 cun horizontal insertion. 2024 systematic review: GV20 third most common insomnia point. Modulates neuroinflammation and cognitive function. Reduces hyperarousal state that prevents sleep.

Point Name: Yintang (印堂 Hall of Impression) - Extra Point
Location: Midpoint between medial ends of eyebrows
TCM Actions: Calms Shen, clears mind, relieves anxiety, opens third eye, descends Yang
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Powerful for sleep onset insomnia. Immediately calms racing mind. Treats anxiety, agitation, mental restlessness from grief. Can feel effect during treatment. Especially good for 'can't turn brain off' pattern.
Needling & Research Evidence: Extra point. 0.3-0.5 cun horizontal toward nose bridge or transverse subcutaneous. High clinical efficacy for immediate calming. Often combined with GV-20 and Anmian. Patients report immediate relaxation response.

Point Name: EX-HN1 (Sishencong 四神聪 Four Alert Spirit)
Location: Four points, 1 cun anterior, posterior, left and right to GV-20
TCM Actions: Calms Shen, clears mind, sharpens mental clarity, reduces excessive thinking
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Excellent for insomnia from mental overwork and rumination. Treats excessive thinking about loss preventing sleep. Clears mental fatigue. Combined with GV-20 creates powerful brain-calming effect.
Needling & Research Evidence: 4 extra points surrounding Baihui. 0.3-0.5 cun horizontal insertion. 2024 review shows frequent use in insomnia protocols. Traditionally for mental exhaustion. Restores mind-body balance for natural sleep.

Location: Between medial malleolus and Achilles tendon, at level of tip of malleolus
TCM Actions: Tonifies Kidney Yin and Yang, nourishes essence, strengthens lower back, grounds energy
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Essential for insomnia from prolonged grief depleting Kidneys. Treats waking at 2-4am (Kidney time), night sweats, fear-based insomnia. Grounds scattered energy. Nourishes root of sleep regulation.
Needling & Research Evidence: Yuan-Source point of Kidney. 0.3-0.5 cun perpendicular. RCT evidence: HT7+KI7 combination effective. KI3 nourishes Yin for Heart-Kidney communication. 2024 systematic review: 8th most common insomnia point. Critical for chronic cases.

Point Name: ST-36 (Zusanli 足三里 Leg Three Miles)
Location: 3 cun below ST-35, one finger width lateral to anterior crest of tibia
TCM Actions: Tonifies Qi and Blood, strengthens Spleen-Stomach, harmonizes middle jiao, regulates immunity
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Foundation point for Qi-Blood deficiency insomnia. Treats fatigue-related sleep issues, weak constitution from grief. Supports overall energy for natural sleep. Harmonizes digestion affecting sleep quality.
Needling & Research Evidence: He-Sea point of Stomach. 0.5-1.5 cun perpendicular. 2024 meta-analysis: 4th most frequent insomnia point. Network topology shows ST36 as core point. Tonification strengthens body's ability to maintain sleep. Can use moxa.

Location: 1.5 cun lateral to lower border of T5 spinous process
TCM Actions: Tonifies and regulates Heart, calms Shen, nourishes Heart Blood and Yin
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Back-Shu point directly influences Heart organ. Treats all Heart-related insomnia: palpitations, anxiety, emotional disturbance. Powerfully calms Shen. Essential for grief affecting Heart-Spirit.
Needling & Research Evidence: Back-Shu point of Heart. 0.5-0.8 cun oblique toward spine. Direct effect on Heart organ. Often combined with HT7 (Front-Back combination). Effective for chronic emotional insomnia. Can use cupping or moxa.

Location: 1.5 cun lateral to lower border of L2 spinous process (at level of umbilicus)
TCM Actions: Tonifies Kidneys, strengthens lower back, nourishes essence, benefits bones
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Back-Shu point for Kidney. Critical for chronic grief insomnia depleting Kidney essence. Treats fear-based insomnia, nighttime urination disrupting sleep, deep fatigue. Strengthens constitutional foundation.
Needling & Research Evidence: Back-Shu point of Kidney. 0.5-1.0 cun perpendicular or oblique. 2024 review: 10th most common insomnia point. Moxa highly effective. Essential for elderly or chronic insomnia from deficiency. Treats root of sleep regulation.

Location: 0.5 cun above anterior hairline, directly above nose on midline
TCM Actions: Calms Shen, clears mind, benefits brain, treats mental disorders
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Excellent for mental-emotional insomnia. Treats racing thoughts, anxiety, fear preventing sleep. Directly affects frontal cortex. Evidence-based for PTSD-related sleep issues. Combines well with Yintang.
Needling & Research Evidence: Du Mai point. 0.3-0.5 cun horizontal insertion along scalp. High frequency in PTSD/anxiety studies. Modulates cognitive function and emotional regulation. Calms overactive mind for sleep onset.

Location: 0.5 cun above HT-7 (wrist crease), radial to flexor carpi ulnaris tendon
TCM Actions: Nourishes Heart Yin, clears deficiency heat, stops night sweats, calms Shen
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Specific for night sweats and five-palm heat disrupting sleep. Treats Yin deficiency insomnia from prolonged grief. Red tongue with scanty coating, feeling hot at night, restless sleep with anxiety.
Needling & Research Evidence: Xi-Cleft point of Heart. 0.3-0.5 cun perpendicular. Acute point for Heart Yin deficiency. Stops night sweats that wake patient. Often combined with KI-3 and SP-6 for Yin nourishing. Immediate effect on deficiency heat.

Location: In middle of wrist crease, between tendons of palmaris longus and flexor carpi radialis
TCM Actions: Clears Heart fire, calms Shen, regulates Heart, opens chest
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Powerful for insomnia with agitation, anxiety, emotional restlessness. Treats 'heartbreak insomnia' from grief. Clears heat from constraint. For patients who feel emotionally overwhelmed preventing sleep.
Needling & Research Evidence: Shu-Stream and Yuan-Source point of Pericardium. 0.3-0.5 cun perpendicular. Sedation point of channel. Strong calming effect. Combines well with HT-8 for excess heat patterns. Clears stagnant emotions blocking sleep.

Location: On dorsum of foot, in depression between 1st and 2nd metatarsal bones
TCM Actions: Spreads Liver Qi, calms Liver Yang, clears Liver fire, regulates menstruation
Indications for Grief-Related Insomnia: Essential when grief causes Liver Qi stagnation with irritability preventing sleep. Treats waking between 1-3am (Liver time), anger-related insomnia, frustration. Moves stagnant emotions.
Needling & Research Evidence: Yuan-Source point of Liver. 0.5-0.8 cun perpendicular. Strong Qi-moving point. Caution with deficiency patterns. Effective for excess-type insomnia with irritability, red sides of tongue. Reduces manipulation if patient weak.

Location: In triangular fossa at bifurcation of superior and inferior antihelix crura
TCM Actions: Calms Shen, relieves anxiety, regulates autonomic nervous system, sedates

Needling & Research Evidence: Key auricular point. 0.2-0.3 cun perpendicular with thin needle or press seeds. 2023 case reports show auricular protocol with Shenmen, Heart, Sympathetic, Point Zero effective for post-COVID insomnia. Modulates parasympathetic activation.

TCM Actions: Nourishes Heart, calms Shen, regulates Heart rhythm

Needling & Research Evidence: Located in concha cymba. Thin needle 0.2-0.3 cun or press seeds. Auricular heart point combined with Shenmen shows high efficacy. Patient can press seeds before sleep for self-treatment.
